ingredients.item: 1 large leek, trimmed, washed and finely sliced

instructions.step: Wash the scallops and dry with kitchen paper. Remove the roe, season and cut them and the scallops in half.
Heat half the butter in a small frying pan and cook the scallops and roe over a high heat for 1 minute on each side until browned. Add the brandy, if using, and boil for a minute. Set aside.

Heat the rest of the butter and oil in a heavy-based pan and add the sliced leek. Cook for a few minutes until softened, then add the rice. Stir for a minute over a medium heat, then add the hot stock a ladleful at a time, stirring until each amount is absorbed by the rice, keeping the mixture gently simmering. Keep adding stock and stirring for about 15-20 minutes until the rice is just tender.

Stir the scallops, roe and any juices, the petits pois, mint and lemon juice into the rice. Cook gently together for a few more minutes until the grains are creamy and soft, and the scallops are heated through. Season to taste. Leave to stand for a couple of minutes, then serve on warm plates.
